about.title: About Our Gurukula
about.subtitle: Founded on the principles of Seva, Sadhana, and Shiksha.
about.intro_text: We provide Both Spiritual and Material Education, to nurture the body, mind, and soul of our students. As followers of Shri Bramha Madhva Gaudiya Sampradaya, we teach our kids the rich tradition of spiritual knowledge handed over to us by our revered Guru Shishya Parampara.
about.prabhupada_text: The divine vision for our Gurukula comes from our Founder-Ācārya, who established ISKCON and envisioned schools that expertly balance spiritual values with modern academics.
about.maharaj_text: Our Gurukula is dedicated in service to our revered Guru Maharaj, whose teachings and blessings are the foundation of our mission to nurture the next generation of devotees.
about.das_prabhu_text: Under the expert guidance of our Shiksha Guru, we provide a nurturing ashram environment where boys build a foundation of character, competence, and lifelong devotion.

team_members.name: HG Sarvabhuta Devi Dasi
team_members.description:
HG Sarvabhuta Devi Dasi (wife of HG Rasanath Das) born and brought up in Kalyan - Maharashtra, Sarvabhuta Mataji is a disciple of HH Bhakti Raghav Swami Maharaj (HDGSP), she is an experienced and trained teacher having more than 15 years of experience in teaching, she has completed her Msc in Environment Science and BEd (Science & Maths) from Mumbai University, 
Prior to working as a teacher, she was working with one of the leading home automation company in the capacity of CDM (clean development management) program manager.
She is now serving as the Principal of BVG (Murbad) where she looks after the education and wellbeing of our kids.

team_members.name: HG Rasanath Das
team_members.description:
Rasanath Das also born and brought up in Kalyan - Maharashtra, is also a disciple of HH Bhakti Raghav Swami Maharaj (HDGSP), he has completed his Graduation in Physics (Mumbai University) and post-graduation in finance (Welingkar institute of Management, Mumbai), he is currently serving in one of the leading investment banks, 
He takes care of the administrative seva in the Gurukul along with teaching kids spiritual subjects like Srimad Bhagavad Gita and Srila Prabhupada's books.

team_members.name: Bhakt Prasad Barakade
team_members.description: Prasad Prabhu hails from Satara - Maharashtra, he is currently pursuing Graduation in Samskrit from IGNOU, he is engaged as a full time teacher in the Gurukul, covering subjects like Marathi and Hindi for students of std-5 to std-8, he is also a district level sportsperson (Wrestling) and looks after the physical fitness of our kids.

seo_description_academics: Explore our balanced curriculum, blending traditional spiritual education with modern academics from MSBOS and NIOS boards.

academics.title: Our Curriculum & Daily Life
academics.subtitle: A balanced education for the mind, body, and soul.

vision_statements.title: Spiritual Foundation
vision_statements.description: Rooting students in the timeless wisdom of the Vedas, Srimad Bhagavatam, and Bhagavad Gita.

vision_statements.title: Character Development
vision_statements.description: Nurturing qualities of compassion, discipline, and selfless service (Seva).

vision_statements.title: Academic Excellence
vision_statements.description: Providing a robust, modern education to build competence for a life of meaningful contribution.

academics.spiritual_text: As followers of the Shri Brahma Madhva Gaudiya Sampradaya, our core syllabus includes Srimad Bhagavad Gita, Srimad Bhagavatam, Mahabharata, Ramayan, and Isopanishad (commented by Srila Prabhupada). Students learn Pranam Mantras, Stotras, and enthusiastically perform Harinam Sankirtan in nearby villages.
academics.academic_text: To provide a strong material education, we follow the MSBOS (Maharashtra State Board for Open Schooling) for 5th to 8th standards and the NIOS (National Institute of Open Schooling) for 10th standard, ensuring our students are fully prepared for higher education and modern life.
academics.skills_text: The Gurukul also strives to teach practical life skills, including traditional farming, sports like wrestling, music (vocals and instruments), and cooking. This creates an environment where students with different abilities can learn, grow, and become positive contributors to society.

seo_description_projects: Help us build the future of the Gurukula. We are seeking support for our new Gaushala, Teachers' Quarters, Yagyashala, and more.

projects.title: Upcoming Projects
projects.subtitle: Help us build the facilities needed to serve our students.

projects.title: 1. New Gaushala
projects.summary: A safe, all-weather shelter for our beloved cows with fans, lights, and proper fodder storage.
projects.description: Cows are already here at our Gurukula, but we are facing problems during the rainy season. Our vision is to build a new Gaushala equipped with exhaust fans, ceiling fans, warm lights for winter, comfortable cow mats, a dedicated fodder storage area, and a large water tank to ensure our cows are lovingly cared for, no matter the weather.

projects.title: 2. Teachers' Quarters
projects.summary: Simple, dignified living spaces for our dedicated teachers, empowering them to focus on their seva.
projects.description: Our Gurukula is blessed with dedicated teachers who live by our slogan: Shiksha, Sadhana, and Seva. To support their invaluable service, we need to provide them with simple, clean, and functional living spaces. Our goal is to build modest rooms with minimum facilities: an attached toilet/bathroom, an almirah, a bed (for Matajis), a mat (for Prabhujis), a table, a chair, and basic fan, light, and curtain fittings. Providing this stable facility is essential for the long-term betterment of our Gurukula and the students they serve.

projects.title: 3. Yagyashala
projects.summary: A sacred space for teaching students the vital science of yagya, essential for their spiritual education.
projects.description: Sadhana is a pillar of our Gurukula, and a student's spiritual shiksha is incomplete without understanding the science of yagya. We need to build a dedicated Yagyashala where we can perform daily rituals and, most importantly, train our students to perform yagya themselves. We also need to procure yagya equipment, patras (vessels), and paraphernalia for at least 1-2 yagyas in advance, so our students are prepared to lead these sacred ceremonies.

projects.title: 4. Guest Rooms
projects.summary: Simple, clean rooms to host visiting devotees, parents, and scholars who wish to serve the Gurukula.
projects.description: We are often blessed by visiting devotees, parents, and scholars who wish to contribute their time and skills to the Gurukula. We need simple guest rooms to host them. Our plan is to build a few rooms with an attached toilet/bathroom, a table, and a chair. In line with our simple living principles, Prabhuji rooms will have mats, while Mataji rooms will have a simple bed.

projects.title: 5. Temple
projects.summary: The heart of our Gurukula, a space for daily worship, kirtan, and festivals.
projects.description: A temple is the center of a spiritual community. We are planning to build a simple but beautiful temple hall that will be the heart of our Gurukula, a space for daily darshan, kirtan, festivals, and classes for all our students and staff.

projects.title: 6. Setting up Vegetable Farms
projects.summary: Expanding our farm to teach self-sufficiency and grow fresh produce for the Gurukula.
projects.description: Practical farming is a key part of our curriculum. We plan to expand our current farming efforts to set up dedicated vegetable farms. This will not only teach our students valuable skills in self-sufficiency but also provide fresh, organic produce for the Gurukula kitchen.

projects.title: 7. Library
projects.summary: A quiet space for students to study both spiritual and academic subjects.
projects.description: A well-stocked library is essential for both spiritual and academic study. We need to build a dedicated library room and fill it with Srila Prabhupada's books, as well as academic textbooks and other supplementary reading material.

projects.title: 8. Varnashram Community
projects.summary: Building the foundation for a sustainable, self-sufficient community based on Vedic principles.
projects.description: Our long-term vision is to establish a full Varnashram community around the Gurukula. This project is the first step towards creating a sustainable, self-sufficient community based on Vedic principles of simple living and high thinking.

seo_description_admissions: Inquire about admissions to our Gurukula. Find answers to common questions about our fees, residential program, and admission age.

admissions.title: Admissions
admissions.subtitle: Take the first step in your child's transformative education.

faq_items.question: What are the fees for the Gurukula?
faq_items.answer: In line with our guiding vision that education should be available to all, we do not charge any mandatory or forceful fees for tuition or boarding. Our Gurukula operates on the principles of seva and heartfelt contributions from the community.

faq_items.question: How can parents contribute to their child's education?
faq_items.answer: While there are no fixed fees, parents are encouraged to contribute according to their capacity. You can support the Gurukula by sponsoring your child's daily prasadam and other needs, or by offering other forms of seva. We believe this creates a wonderful partnership in the child's upbringing.

faq_items.question: What is the ideal age for admission?
faq_items.answer: We primarily accept students for the 5th standard, as this is an ideal age to begin foundational spiritual and academic training in a Gurukula environment.

faq_items.question: Is this a residential (boarding) program?
faq_items.answer: Yes, Bhaktivedanta Vidyabhavan is a full-time residential program. Students live in a nurturing and disciplined ashram environment which is essential for their holistic development.
